<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.58</value></part><part><name>Game Version (number surrounded by NO SPACES)</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Roads and Airports </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns a road segment containing given position, [[objNull]] otherwise. Same as [[isOnRoad]] only returns the actual road object instead of boolean. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''roadAt''' position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Object]] or  [[Array]] in format [[PositionAGL]] (especially on bridges) or (since Arma 3 v1.99.146460) [[Position2D]], in which case Z will be automatically deduced as the height of the road surface  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] - road segment or [[objNull]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_road = [[roadAt]] [[ASLToAGL]] [[getPosASL]] [[player]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_isOnRoad = ![[isNull]] [[roadAt]] [[player]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> For detecting bridges, for example<code>[[getModelInfo]] ([[roadAt]] [[ASLToAGL]] [[getPosASL]] [[player]]); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>["bridgesea_01_f.p3d","a3\structures_f_exp\infrastructure\bridges\bridgesea_01_f.p3d",true]</value></part></template></code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[nearRoads]], [[roadsConnectedTo]], [[isOnRoad]], [[surfaceIsWater]], [[getRoadInfo]], [[nearestTerrainObjects]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 30, 2016 - 21:40 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:OOKexOo|OOKexOo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command does not nessecarly return the segment which center is the closest to the given position.<br>
In order to get such segment use [[nearRoads]].<br>
<code>_closest_road &#61; (_pos [[nearRoads]] 0.1) select 0;</code>
</dd>
</dl>
